provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Rules may be ci,ted as the Quarantine (Air) (Disinsectisation
of Aircraft) Rules. 1994.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2.--41) The Commander of every aircraft arriving in the Island shall,
prior to landing d any member d the crew or any passenger or cargo.
produce t~ t h e satisfaotion of %he Health Officer, a certificate issued
by a competent authority specifying that the aircratt has been treated
with one of bhe approved residual insecticides specified in Part A of
the Schedule.                                                             Schedule.

     (b) be valid for a period of thirty days or for such other period

      (3) In this paragraph "competent authority" means-
    (a) in relation to Jamaica, the Quarantine Authority;
    (6) in relation to any other country, the person who, or organiza-
        tion which, has authority to certify under the laws of that
        country relating to public health, that the aircraft in respect
        of which a certificate is issued h,as been disinfected in that

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Where-
    (a) the commander fails to produce a certificate or produces an
        invalid certificate; or
     (b) ithe aircraft originates from or lands en route in an infected
          area or an endemic area or an area from which it is liable
          to bring inseot vectors of malaria or other diseases,
the Health Officer, may, as he thinks it fit and without prejudice to any
other power conferred upon him under the Act. cause the aircraft to
be disinsected on lthe ground on arrival and prior to landing of any
member of the crew or any passenger or cargo with one of the approved
aerosol formulation speccified in Part B of the Schedule.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. The residual insecticide referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3 shall
be applied in suoh a manner that-
     (a) on the first application thereof, treatment results in not less
         than 0.5 g.a.i.lm2 remaining on all carpets and 0.2 g.a.i./mz
         remaining on cargo compartments, baggage holds and all other
         surfaces; and
     (b) on each subsequent application, treatment results in not less
         than 0.2 g.a.i./mZ remaining on all carpets and 0.1 g.a.i.1~12
         remaining on all other surfaces.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. Disinsectisation by means of an aerosol formulation, shall be
done by dispensing the treatment uniformly in all possible places where
inseots may be sheltered at a ratio of 35g of the formulation per lOOm2
(log per 1000 cu. ft.) of enclosed space and at the rate of 0.1-0.2g per
second.
               (The inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N. 4119971
        THE QUARANTINE (AIR) (DISll\rSBCTISATION OF AIRCRAFT)
                           RULES, 1994

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.-(1) All aerosols and residual insecticides used in the treatment
    of aircraft shall conform to international standards.
          (2) For the punposes of these Rules, the insecticidal formulation
    and its dispenser shall be regarded as a single unit required to produce
    the aerosol.
\
           (3) The net weight and composition of the insecticidal formula-
    tion, the discharge rate and the date of manufaoture thereof shall be
    indicated on each container.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7.-(1) The Health Officer shall cause to be treated in an aircraft
    by means of disinsectisation, all cupboards, closets, chests, toilets, com-
    partments and all possible places where inse~tsmay be sheltered, so,
    however, that all foodstuff and utensils which may be inside the aircraft
    at the time of disinsectisation are protected from contamination.
          (2) The Health Officer shall ensure that-
        (a) passenger compartrnenh;
        (b) crew compartments;
        (c) cargo compartments and baggage holds; and
        (d) all apertures of the aircraft, both internal and external,
    are kept tightly closed during ,treatment and for a period of not less
    than five minutes after completion of the treatment.
